sources.title: Knock On Any Door (1949) Director Nicholas Ray, Starring Humphrey Bogart, John Derek
sources.description: Knock on Any Door is a 1949 American courtroom trial FILM NOlR directed by Nicholas Ray and starring Humphrey Bogart. The picture gave actor John Derek his breakthrough role, and was based on the 1947 novel of the same name by Willard Motley. Â  You can find out more about this movie from Wikipedia . There is also a good review of the movie here from the movie blog Senses of Cinema .

metadata.Plot: Andrew Morton is an attorney who made it out of the slums. Nick Romano is his client, a young man with a long string of crimes behind him. After he lost his paycheck gambling, hoping to buy his wife some jewelry, she announced she was pregnant, Later he finds her dead from suicide. When he turns again to robbery he's caught by a cop and Nick pumps all his bullets into him in frustration. Morton's appeal to the court emphasizes the evils of the slums.
metadata.Writer: Daniel Taradash, John Monks Jr., Willard Motley
metadata.Actors: Humphrey Bogart, John Derek, George Macready
